website_summaries.verdict: Storage and intensity of workout are this model's best selling points. We recommend it primarily to users with smaller stride lengths who don't mind a steeper incline angle while walking.
pros: Folds and locks in upright position for easy storage
cons: Assembly can be very challenging, with some damaged parts reported
Incline is steep (12.5 degrees), so not ideal for impaired or elderly users

customer_reviews.title: Great little treadmill
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying this treadmill. It has a small profile for my small living space, it was pretty easy to put together, and it makes walking so easy and convenient during the winter months when I do not want to walk outside in the cold. I tightened the tension quite a bit. Without tightening the tension, the tread seemed too slick for my comfort. I am glad I opted for a manual treadmill as opposed to an electric one. I like that my movement controls the speed of the treadmill as opposed to an electric model. I am thrilled with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mileva

customer_reviews.title: had this since 2014
customer_reviews.text: I love this treadmill. Like most people, I start and stop using it. I just started again after the holidays and thought it was time to write a review. Its small enough to move around easily but very sturdy. The tread still slides smoothly over the base. (I keep the area between the tread and base well dusted with a Swiffer.) The only advice I can offer to get the best results is to use a smooth even heel to toe stride. If you come down flat footed you'll press the tread against the base instead of pushing it along the base.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Kent

customer_reviews.title: but that is part of what I love about it
customer_reviews.text: I have had this treadmill for almost 2yrs, and I still use it regularly. I am 240lbs, and yes, many reviews complain about the manual nature of it. However, I was used to it by the first day, and it may add a bit more of a workout while walking, but that is part of what I love about it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Corey

customer_reviews.title: This is OK probably as good as you can get without a motor
customer_reviews.text: This is OK probably as good as you can get without a motor. 100% cannot walk on this and use a laptop like a desk treadmill. You must hold on to the railings to apply enough force to push the belt. Don't think you are different. It's not happening. Can do light jogging but do not expect this to be like a motorized treadmill. Way different. You need to develop a certain amount of coordination and pacing to make walking on this feel natural. However you can get a good walk in and get used to it after a couple minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Gramathon

customer_reviews.title: This is exactly what I need
customer_reviews.text: I work from home and it is sometimes difficilt to get to the gym. I have a small house and this treadmill is the perfect solution to my space problem. This is so different when compared to an electric treadmill. It feels like my entire body is getting a workout. You definitely need to go at it slow and gradually increase the time walking. The one thing that do not like is the set incline. I slid down a few times but I glued a few pieces of leftover marble tile and placed it under the machine and now it’s much easier walking.
customer_reviews.author: JME

customer_reviews.title: It's worth buying IF you're going to use it
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the short person (I'm 5'2") who is not excessively overweight. Best for short person because you need a short stride to stay onboard. Like that it doesn't have "all the bells and whistles" or high-priced motorized machines. Don't need all that. Fair price, excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine L.

customer_reviews.title: Buy at your own risk.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was easy until I got to part 32 named Front Support. The width of the support was a full .25" or more shorter than the span of the base to which it attached; even when parts 17 & 18 were fully tightened. I could have bent the support to fit the base, but in my opinion the factory should make sure that I don't have to modify parts. At this point the product was disassembled and repackaged. No stars. P.S. This got one star because it was required. For this type of mess, I would give it negative stars. Now there's the inconvenience of returning said product.
customer_reviews.author: nolabelle

customer_reviews.title: A Nice Little Starter Treadmill
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, easy to operate, and for what I needed, walking, it works perfectly. There are only two things I would change: 1) The padding is up near the timer, which makes for a very awkward handhold. It should be on the actual handles, which are metal and get all sweaty and gross. 2) I wish instead of being on a fixed incline, it was adjustable, because sometimes I'd like to walk without furiously gripping the handles (you have to hold on, otherwise you go flying off); I have carpal tunnel, so this agitates my pain. I wish I could lower it and use my arms too. Aside from that, the price is right for what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: lily zen

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine
customer_reviews.text: I could not afford a large electric treadmill and this one just suits me fine. Your own energy powers the belt and it is small and light enough for me to handle. I have it up in my sewing room and use it for up to a half hour at a time. It does have a battery operated timer etc. which is a bit flimsy but appears to work well enough. I've had it for over six months and haven't had any problems so far. I have it on a mat so that my floors won't show wear in that spot.
customer_reviews.author: kat

customer_reviews.title: Easy and foldable.
customer_reviews.text: This treadmill is super easy to set up, but it does take some time to do. You should set aside about 30 to 40 minutes to assemble this puppy and that would do it. After it is set up, it is great to use. Nothing fancy but just does what it is suppose to. It also folds back in one piece so you can store it on the wall or under your futon. Overall, we like this machine. So far so good after using it for a few weeks every single day. We rate it 4 out of 5 Stars.' We purchased this product at full price and decided to go with it due to the positive rating.
customer_reviews.author: PDUBSNY

customer_reviews.title: good value, belt sticks when going at slower pace
customer_reviews.text: never tried a manual treadmill before this one. its very light and easy to move around, which is a plus. you can definitely get a good workout on it, since it forces the incline and makes your leg muscles work harder. the electronic display is a plus, but i dont trust the data on that thing--i think it may be underestimating distance ran. the belt sticks a little when going at a slower pace (e.g., walking). also, folding and setting up requires screwing/unscrewing two bolts with knobs, which isnt hard but makes for a little inconvenience. overall, a good value id say. cant complain at well under two hundred.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Ian Staker

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive way to complete a gym.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, fairly compact to fold and stow. It is a good alternative to the much more expensive motorized treadmills. But it is not easy to work out on this. First of all, the user has to be the "motor". And due to the slightly sloped treadmill part, the user is constantly in a "going uphill" movement. Then the user is constantly having to use their arm(s) to support their body while exercising. So even a short workout on it can be a thrasher. Jogging on it is awkward but possible. Overall, it is handy to have around when weather conditions preclude outdoor exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Mister K

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I knew this was a very inexpensive treadmill, so I didn't have super-high expectations, but it felt much cheaper and more flimsy than I expected. The track slipped a lot, making it very difficult to walk on. I had to devote 100% attention to just not falling on my face, so it would have been utterly impossible to exercise while watching a TV show or something. I decided I'd rather just save my money and get a higher quality treadmill later, so I sent this one back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: B. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: I love treadmills but...
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on this one, but it didn't work out. I wanted to love it, because of the price, but it is just too hard to use. As a lover of motorized treadmills, I thought this could work, but nope. There is no way to use it without holding on to the handles. Forget a nice stroll -- you will be out of breath.***EDIT 29 May 2013 - We put it out on the street a few nights ago along with the instruction manual, someone picked it up, perhaps for scrap metal.
customer_reviews.author: zee1

customer_reviews.title: Just Okay
customer_reviews.text: It falls down after I fold it up. VERY DANGEROUS for pets, children and my own toes. It also takes up more room than I like. You must hold the handrails at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected!
customer_reviews.text: Weight limit was not displayed apon purchase ended up being too heavy for it by 20 pounds and I'm 171 pounds
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware, manual treadmills require a lot more effort to use than motorized ones.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for physical therapy. It was very easy to assemble and came with all the necessary parts and tools in a very nice blister pack. Instructions were very clear and easy to follow. I had the treadmill assembled in around 45 minutes. As far as using it, this treadmill requires a lot more effort to use than a motorized one, which I actually think is a plus, however it might be too difficult for some people. If you find the walking surface sticking give it a few sprays with WD40 and it should loosen it up. Overall I'm satisfied with this treadmill.
customer_reviews.author: N. C.

customer_reviews.title: Caused me 100% fewer tears than anything I've ever built from Ikea.
customer_reviews.text: This isn't the fanciest treadmill on the planet, it's about the noise level of the dishwasher (just turn up the TV/podcast/etc) and it won't hold up my Kindle. Aside from those pitfalls, I'd still recommend this treadmill. It folds up easily enough, gets my heart rate up and I don't find the belt too narrow to walk on (I am 5'8" 155ish lbs). I did notice the timer isn't accurate - I ran it against a stopwatch app and it came out to show 13 minutes for each 15 that had actually lapsed, so I just count in increments of 13 minutes (so 52 minutes on the machine actually equals an hour).
customer_reviews.author: EBW

customer_reviews.title: I'm 57 and always like treadmills. However
customer_reviews.text: I'm 57 and always like treadmills. However, I live in a tiny house and can't afford a gym membership or a fancy expensive treadmill. This is working perfectly for me. I have it set up right in front of the t.v. Right now I'm hopping on and off for shorter periods of time to build up my endurance. It gives you quite a workout! Putting it together wasn't very difficult...just follow the directions.
customer_reviews.author: AfternoonTea

customer_reviews.title: the incline is not fun
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was easy, but walking on this is always at a steep incline, which means there is no strolling along...you really have to work hard. I wanted something for light walking, and I break a sweat on this every time. I just put it out to the curb, in the hopes someone will pick it up and get more use out of it than I did.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi The Firefly Fan

customer_reviews.title: and it's compact & easy enough to fold up when I need the space
customer_reviews.text: At the time I paid $135 and that was a fair value. This gets me cardiovascular activity with the convenience of not leaving the house, without the cost of a high-end treadmill, and it's compact & easy enough to fold up when I need the space. The incline definitely adds some challenge to it, but I love it, it gives a little bit of leg strength training at the same time and keeps your heart rate higher giving you more out of less time.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Dexter

customer_reviews.title: Decent manual, not great for 200lbs +
customer_reviews.text: The setup was pretty easy; I weigh 220 lbs and if I'm not focused on my stride then I get tripped up a little. I was able to use it continuously while watching the Daily Show and I definitely felt it afterwards. I'd also recommend it for someone shorter than me, I'm 5'11", the sweet spot is someone who is probably 5'2" - 5'7". The verdict is still out, but don't expect this to be a great substitute to one you might find at a gym.
customer_reviews.author: Sean L Leber-Fennessy

customer_reviews.title: It works perfectly for me!!
customer_reviews.text: Before purchased it, I was wondering if a manual treadmill really work or not. Now I can tell you that it works really good! I had a moto treadmill before and sold it becuz I need more space for the room. Now I decided to get it back to exercise when watch TV, but I do not want a big moto treadmill to take out the space of my living room. I searched the reviews and decided to give this one a try. It was shippied by a very good packaging, and easy installation about 15 min. Everything works good and it really provides me some work out!! Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin F Clark

customer_reviews.title: Singing in the rain :)
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It is well made, very sturdy, and I use it every day. Neither rain, nor sleet, nor snow will keep me from enjoying the walk on this treadmill. I don't even miss my TV shows while enjoying my walk. It even keeps my grandchildren from being too bored while visiting in my small apartment. It folds up nicely so it doesn't take up too much space. It also rolls into the bedroom if guests should arrive for a visit.
customer_reviews.author: yogiandbooboo

customer_reviews.title: A couple minor irritations.
customer_reviews.text: First, this didn't come shipped with a manual or directions of any kind. However, I contacted the seller and they sent it to me right away and I got it within a day. It was a little annoying to put together, but not more so than anything that has "assembly required". It isn't bad to walk on minus a slight hiccup with the belt whenever the portion they stuck together to make a loop goes underneath next to the floor. Other than that it is light and easy to store and move around.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Allen

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the treadmill for about a month and I love it. It works great. I like the idea that unlike a motorized one that I use to have, there is almost no noise when using it. Room is an issue so it’s a perfect size. But regardless of the size, even if I had the room, I would prefer this one over a larger motorized one. The incline was a little to much so I raised the back end up about an inch and it’s perfect. I would definitely recommend it - Reuven
customer_reviews.author: Reuven

customer_reviews.title: it's super tiny, and the model must have been a ...
customer_reviews.text: I laughed when I seen just the box ...it's super tiny ,and the model must have been a bite size adult ...easy to assemble works OK ...but it feel as if you to to tighten it often if used every day
customer_reviews.author: tomika barnett

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent treadmill
customer_reviews.text: I have never been on a 'manual' treadmill before; it takes a little to get used to walking on it with a consistent speed, though that almost makes it more fun! Putting together wasn't hard, instructions were clear. I will say you should check the bolts periodically and tighten as needed to keep the unit stable, especially while moving. Otherwise, this is a good way to get in some exercise at home and doesn't take up much space or cost as much as an electric treadmill.
customer_reviews.author: Aprtopaz

customer_reviews.title: Phoenix 98510 Manual Treadmill
customer_reviews.text: This machine came yesterday and I put it together this morning. The instructions are very clear and only took me an hour and a half to assemble which I did by myself. I am a 57 year old woman. I know it says if to tighten the belt, there are 2 screws at the end of the belt. Maybe I didn't turn it the right direction but the belt still seems to go pretty fast. Hard to believe it is only a manual. All connections to the computer were easy and appears to be working fine.
customer_reviews.author: athena314

customer_reviews.title: A Real Workout
customer_reviews.text: Because this is mechanical, it provides a real workout. I walk 3 miles a day, but in inclement weather I'm stuck inside. 25 minutes on this item works up a sweat like 3 miles in 80 degree heat. I really like it. Belt has not tracked left or right and hasn't needed lube yet. Comes pretty much pre-assembled, and all the screws and bolts are clearly labeled. I put it together myself, but it would be easier with two people because the rails can be unwieldy for one person.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup
customer_reviews.text: So far this has proved to be a great product. It is very easy to setup and operate. This is a manual treadmill so it operates on your own leg power. I like this because it keeps me from "getting lazy". I have to work to get it to go. I recommend lubricating the belt so that it slides better but other than that I have no complaints. One other note, it has a slight incline but no way to adjust that if you want a steeper climb. Overall great product for a fraction of the cost of electric tradmills.
customer_reviews.author: S. Emberton

customer_reviews.title: I was injured in military duty and this has greatly ...
customer_reviews.text: I was injured in military duty and this has greatly improved my balance and stamina. Short learning curve to use it and understand may not be for everyone but wish I could buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: John Mac

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought it after reading reviews and figuring out that this equipment would be a good way to get started, since the price is low and Amazon ships it for free. My husband assembled it in about 30 minutes. It works very well. The incline is at a comfortable level We have used high-end treadmills but see no reason to buy an expensive one considering how good this one for basic walking needs. Highly recommended product.
customer_reviews.author: V. Herbert

customer_reviews.title: It is a workout
customer_reviews.text: The unit was easy to set up. The exercise routine is much more strenuous than walking on a motorized Treadmill. I was able to walk at a good pace on a motorized unit for an hour but I am working slowly up to a half hour on the this unit. I do feel once I get my stamina up that the workout will be a substantial one and get me ready for hiking in the Springtime. I did have to lessen the incline in order to get into a smooth pace. I will slowly increase the incline as I get stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast!
customer_reviews.text: Let me tell you now... If you're out of shape like I was, this will kick your butt. It doesn't seem like it, but it will. That incline doesn't look like much in the picture (or even in person) but once you're on the thing, it's crazy. I really don't know why people would want to spend thousands of dollars on fancy powered treadmills when this offers the most strenuous workout I've ever had on a treadmill. Definitely worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: jen86

customer_reviews.title: Great little treadmill. Folds and moves easily.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2013 it's 2018 now. Still using the same treadmill. Add a little lubrication to the belt and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ndryan

customer_reviews.title: Not a heavy duty price or treadmill.
customer_reviews.text: This treadmill makes you work harder, which is kind of the point, right? My wife is happy because I can put it in the closet when not in use. This is not a heavy-duty machine. It went together easily, but I don't expect it to last a really long time as it it seems flimsy when I fold it up. The price is excellent for what one gets. Here's hopin' this helps me lose weight!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong!
customer_reviews.text: Love this manual treadmill! Once you get into the groove you just keep going. The set up was easy, but the digital panel doesn't work. Has a cup holder, but no area for a phone/tablet. I still love this treadmill anyway because it's strong and study for the price
customer_reviews.author: Prof. Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Manual Treadmill a hit
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this treadmill for my cousin who had a recent stroke and is caring for her mother who also is an invalid. Sharon tells me it is so convenient that she can use it in the same room as her mother so she is not very far away and it is not noisy. They have little space so she appreciates the compactness of the treadmill and she uses it for 30 minutes twice a day. Hopefully she will soon regain use of all her limbs.
customer_reviews.author: BikerKris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that it was going to be difficult to walk on because your momentum makes the track move, but it's not so. If I had the money, I'd buy an electric, but at this price this is a very reasonable solution. Also, the timer on this works very well, which isn't the case on most of these cheap exercise machines. I knocked a star off because once it's folded up, it's still too large to push under most beds. I think the design could've been better in that regard. Overall, though, I'd buy this again and I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ioannis Batsios Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Avid runner, stands up to the abuse
customer_reviews.text: I run on this thing everyday for 30 minutes for the past 3 months. Amazing deal and stands up to the abuse. At first it can be hard to balance and run to power the treadmill instead of an electric one. However I got used to it quickly and I enjoy this over large bulky electric ones now.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Want something doesn't take space, light weight, doesn't cost much, easy to use. We bought this because has more place to hold on. Works for Kids and adult. Mainly for my kid who needs loss some weight for walk. Sometimes we don't have time to go out with them. This one works for when cold, rain, hot days.
customer_reviews.author: S L.

customer_reviews.title: treadmill
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery. I was skeptical because it is a manual and I didn't think it would be as good as an electric treadmill but I was pleasantly surprised. it fits perfectly in my small living room and works really really well . I only stay on it for 5 - 10 minutes at a time and feel a good workout. it does what it says its going to do. very good product. well made too. I would recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: A Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for an affordable one of these for a long time. Ignore the negative reviews as they are written by people you don't haw to assemble products or how to adjust them properly. I had no problems, it was assembled and up in twenty minutes, I lubed it as one reviewer suggested and it was adjusted and ready to go; all of this within an hour. It is not hard to use at all.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Arden Sellick

customer_reviews.title: Works as designed
customer_reviews.text: I have this treadmill in my bedroom, but haven't bothered to "fold it up" to regain floor space. The unit works as designed and I've had no problems with the belt being jerky or anything. Just grasp the handle bars when getting on it and with your first step back, push against the belt like you really mean it! LOL (This review left by Alan's wife, user of said product).
customer_reviews.author: The Bees Knees

customer_reviews.title: For My Grands
customer_reviews.text: We needed a tredmill that would be safe for our Grand children to walk on, this turned out to be the right one for all three grands. It moved at their pace because there was no power, they had to be the power sourse. Now when it's raining or snowing outside the kids can get the exercise they need without tearing up the house. Happy GrandDad.
customer_reviews.author: Fred W. Bullard

customer_reviews.title: very nice
customer_reviews.text: very nice. Even though it is a portable foldaway, it is not too small and nowhere near as big as a regular one. I love the bright orange color. It isn't a quiet as I would like but not overly loud. Only thing not happy with is the directions were horrbile and you couldn't see anything in the pictures. The directions to operate it are impossible to undersand. You might have to call for help/ Also 2 of the nuts were missing so I had to run out and buy them. I would certainly recomend this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this is a great buy. Yeah
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a great buy. Yeah, it is no treadmill with a motor to keep you going. But it is a great workout when you can't walk outside. I think even more so than a motorized treadmill! And it stops when you stop. It won't throw you off the back of it because the motor is still running. For me, a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: great workout
customer_reviews.text: I am really liking this treadmill. It's a great workout. It was easy to put together and it's easy to put up and move around my room when I'm ready to use it. I would of given it a 5 star but when you fold it up, it's a little inconvenient to take the bottom screw out to fold it up and then put the screw back in. Not horrible but seems like there could be a better method. Otherwise, it's a very good buy!!
customer_reviews.author: B. Mariano

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend buying a electric treadmill
customer_reviews.text: Its a okay treadmill, but you do have to hold on while walking on it. You will not be able to run on it. When I first walked on it, the belt stopped alot until I sprayed it with lubricant and walked on it alittle bit.It has a incline which gives you a harder workout. I bought it for less then the listed price (170.00) and do not feel it is worth the price.I would recommend buying a electric treadmill.
customer_reviews.author: Keisha

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Super simple, sturdy, well engineered and provides a good cardio bump while it's too cold & nasty to go outside. Excellent deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: which is great for portability and storage
customer_reviews.text: This just never worked for me. It sticks a ton, even when using a spray lubricant. It is very narrow and short, which is great for portability and storage, but it really limits range of motion. It has held up well and is nice and compact, but it isn't as comfortable to use as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Jancee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for basic needs
customer_reviews.text: My perferred form of exercise is walking, not running. So my household did not need those super expensive machines you see in spas or gyms. This treadmill is perfect for my needs as well as those of my father who is diabetic. Since you "power" the treadmill by simply walking, there is little risk of an accident. It will only go as fast or slow as you walk. Though it is not as sophisticated as those costing 10x more, if all you need is a basic walking machine that measures the time, speed, and calories burned, this is for you. It is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: ctm

customer_reviews.title: Imagine: A treadmill that doesn't need it's own room!
customer_reviews.text: I love how compact this is. I can't speak to the length of the stride for taller people (I'm only 5' 2") but it's great for me. The belt is smooth, and it was SO simple to put together. It's not so heavy that I couldn't get it up the stairs by myself. Although the little feet on the back did want to catch on the lip of the tread, I was able to do it before my husband got home from work, and without injury. Bonus: it fits in the closet when it's folded up!
customer_reviews.author: Carla Archibald

customer_reviews.title: Works ok for running..
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this treadmill thinking it would help me work off some of the holiday pounds I gained. It was easy enough to assemble but when I first tried it, it sticks if you just walked normally on it. Does not work with ease. It was great if you run but I am not at that place yet with my workout. I am a bit dissappointed and wish I saved the box, I would send it back.
customer_reviews.author: D Harrison

customer_reviews.title: This treadmill came into our home around one year ago ...
customer_reviews.text: This treadmill came into our home around one year ago. The treadmill works exactly as advertised, aside from the digital tracker which wasn't much of a surprise. I have finally decided to sell this treadmill for a motorized model. I found the manual treadmill to be very difficult to maintain for more than 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Candice Cardenas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome machine for the price
customer_reviews.text: This treadmill is awesome. It was easy to put together and easy to fold up and roll away. I get a great workout on it - sweating bullets and with the heart rate up! I wouldn't recommend this machine for someone who has been working out for years on a treadmill at the gym. It's a totally different experience. I had been using the elliptical for years and wanted something different. Amazon did a great job with shipping and delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer505

customer_reviews.title: basic, affordable treadmill
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT a $3,500 treadmill. But if you're looking for a treadmill that will provide a great workout and is affordable, lightweight, compact, easy to assemble and easy to use, this item is PERFECT!
customer_reviews.author: Gatorgal

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent product!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent manual treadmill to use to add to your exercise routine at home. It is light weight to move around and the right size for a small room. It requires very little maintenance. It firms up your leg muscles, buttocks, and lower abdomen. I am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: W. Soto

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for years still works. Easy to fold and put away
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It is easy to assemble and east to maintain. This treadmill is self-powered so it takes more energy to use. Because it is self-powered, you burn more calories. You control the pace. Walk slow, walk fast, jog, or run, its up to you. Great product at a great value.
customer_reviews.author: vyk_2000

customer_reviews.title: Happpy Customer
customer_reviews.text: I reveiced this unit in great condition. It was really eaasy to assemble. It went from box to use in about 15 minutes. Instructions were easy to read. Unit works smooth and easy. I'm 200 lbs and I can get a pretty quick jog on it without worry of it breaking. My only complaint is that it doesnt have an adjustable incline feature but other that that it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Silver XS Max

customer_reviews.title: Love this treadmill
customer_reviews.text: I would give this a 5 because I love it so much but I only give it a four because the name is deceiving (easy up) it's not the best for space and not easy to fold up ...you have to take out parts and screws to fold it up but other than that this is a GREAT treadmill for the money and I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: shoppingmom4two

customer_reviews.title: Easier to jog on than walking
customer_reviews.text: After doing some research and finding good treadmills go for about 1,000 I decided to try a manual treadmill. I have only had it for two weeks but so far I really like it. It was easy to assemble, I did it by myself. It is very easy to maneuver it around the house. Walking has been a little awkward but jogging on it is very natural.
customer_reviews.author: David Marta

customer_reviews.title: I am a small woman (5') and this is perfect. I was trail walking and got this for ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a small woman (5') and this is perfect. I was trail walking and got this for times that it is inconvenient to be outside, the workout is great due to the grade and the fact that you are the engine. If you are not tall or do not have a long stride then this will work for you. I have walked approximately 25 miles on this and have not had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Maria C Delagarza

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: I been looking for a small and affordable treadmill, this treadmill was easy to build and its very easy to put away. Its great for the price, the main feature i like is that you have to put your own effort to make it work. Works well for small workouts, well worth the money. Shipping was fast!
customer_reviews.author: PinkKisses

customer_reviews.title: Great for starting out
customer_reviews.text: Belt shifts quite a bit but overall pretty good. If your just starting out you'll feel your heart pumping and might even break a sweat within 5mins
customer_reviews.author: C. T.

customer_reviews.title: Suits me perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I love this treadmill. I find it easy to run on, smooth operation. I like the fact that it's fairly compact in size, not bulky, and is manual so it makes me do all the work. Also, it's very quiet! I didn't assemble it myself, but the person who did it for me told me it is very easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Jane S.

customer_reviews.title: Track stops if you put too much weight on it ...
customer_reviews.text: Track stops if you put too much weight on it. I usually have to brace part of my weight on the handle bars or it will stop. I'm not very heavy either (about 150 lbs). I can't really run properly without holding on.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Leong

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine!
customer_reviews.text: Love it so far! Wanted something inexpensive in the treadmill department, wanted something I could power myself. Easy to set up, I did it all on my own, and was able to use it right away. It's great, handy with the timer/calorie counter/distance gizmo. For the money - well spent!
customer_reviews.author: bghorsegal

customer_reviews.title: Not really happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Not really happy with this purchase, very difficult to use and you have to be holding onto the handle bars otherwise you'll fall off lol
customer_reviews.author: Dametz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent equipment for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent equipment for the price. It fold up easily, arrived on time and very easy to put together. I'm 45 wpman 215 lbs and I do sñow pase 2.2 mph. You have to catch your pace to make it move and hold ln to the bars always.
customer_reviews.author: Karlajustme

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to be able to get in some walking indoors with the Chicago winter coming up. Easy to assemble in less than 30 minutes. Great workout; you control the intensity by moving your legs faster or slower. Really can get the heart going. I use it for 10 minutes in the morning and 20 minutes in the evening. Couldn't be happier with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: sbirny

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, Easy to use, I LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: This product was exactly as described, which was exactly what I was looking for! Its really convenient, and easy to get out of the way. The incline is perfect, it is really easy to get going. Overall, I'm very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Keller

customer_reviews.title: I guess you get what you pay for. Belt ...
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for. Belt is jerky and not smooth so if you are walking and don't forget (on an incline ) you have to hold on. Wouldn't get again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have had this treadmill for 3 years and I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this treadmill for 3 years and I use it every day. I am a 71 year old, 5 feet tall woman with a weight of 120 lbs and it fits me perfectly. I walk for 5 to 10 minutes several times a day. I suffer from restless legs at night and this treadmill is a drug-free remedy - 5 minutes of walking takes care of the problem and I can go blissfully back to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: This treadmill is not good to walk on
customer_reviews.text: This treadmill is not good to walk on. Description says it is certified up to 250 lbs., but when I walk on it, keeps getting stuck. I've had to loosen the belt a lot and use a lot of lubricant in order to make the walk tolerable. I weigh 230 lbs, and I am trying to lose weight, but I rather walk outside than use this belt. This was one purchase I deeply regret.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product but hate that the incline cannot be adjusted
customer_reviews.text: Great product but hate that the incline cannot be adjusted. I would have like to start on a straight incline and not the uphhill incline right away. The incline should have been where you can adjust it.
customer_reviews.author: madbull

customer_reviews.title: manual treadmills are not for everyone.
customer_reviews.text: if you are used to the electric treadmill at the gym, i strongly caution you to buy a manual one... try a manual one before you buy it. the value is good, the machine works fine... but I just cant get used to the manual one. I don't like it.... but that is just me.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: This machine is exactly what was advertised. It's a manual treadmill which makes you work harder and you have to hold on to the handles to avoid losing balance and possibly falling but I tie a string to the handles so it holds me in place and keeps me from falling or losing balance. It's not bad for the price but I wish I could affort a better treadmill. I love jogging so this manual treadmill is not exactly what I need to get the results I want. It's OK for me because I'm not too bit (5 feet tall; 130lbs) but I suspect wouldn't be as good for anyone bigger than that as it's not very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Nay

customer_reviews.title: this little machine is great and is saving my life
customer_reviews.text: this little machine is great and is saving my life! i bought it for the handles and I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam A. Wolcott

customer_reviews.title: I love my treadmill
customer_reviews.text: I love my treadmill! It's a lot more work to make a treadmill go with your own power, thus burning more calories. This isn't a good treadmill to run on though as their isn't enough length on the tread surface area. Good for a walker though.
customer_reviews.author: BONITA KRUSE

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Good treadmill, it took me awhile to get used to it as I have never used a manual treadmill before. Once I found my groove I love it,it's like walking up a small incline and I can really get my heart rate up . The counter/timer never worked but that wasn't that important to as I use a different device for that.
customer_reviews.author: I'm a wolf rider, I'm free

customer_reviews.title: my wife liked it more than me
customer_reviews.text: This Treadmill was ok but i don't use it anymore. my wife liked it more than me. I don't like that you have to hold on to the bars everytime you use it to push down on the treadmill with your feet in order to move it. Whats good about it, is that it doesn't take up to much space because the bottom lifts up and you can stand it in a corner. oh and i found it hard for running on it because like i said you have to hold on to the bars. best for walking on it
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas Nolasco

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly and was on it sweating in 15 mins
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly and was on it sweating in 15 mins! Added this in for some solid cardio into powerlifting routine and hamstrings were on fire!
customer_reviews.author: Abbe

customer_reviews.title: Good manual treadmill
customer_reviews.text: -Fairly easy to put together -takes up little space -easy to move -can run on it -counter doesn't work well but I have other devices I can use for that -good buy for the money
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Wasted
customer_reviews.text: This is an unstable machine. I give a star for timeliness. I ended up trashing it. Wasted money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: JUST WHAT I WANTED--PERFECT FOR HOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: This treadmill is just what I wanted and perfect for my home. I put it together myself in 30 minutes. It's smooth, easy to use, not noisy for me as other reviewers have said. This definitely gives you a workout. I use the motorized treadmill at the gym on the weekends, and I can tell that I'm getting a better workout on this manual model at home. I highly recommend this product. Excellent value for the price, and a great way to start getting serious about exercising more in the New Year!!! THANKS!!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: I'm quite pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: So far, I'm quite pleased with it. I had triple bypass last year so I was a little concerned about the incline but it's not bad. I'm glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meets all expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with this purchase. Simple to assemble. Easy to use. I purchased it for my work office for a quick afternoon wake-me-up walk, and it's definitely serving its purpose. It fits perfectly in one of the corners of my office. If I have any critique at all, it would be wishing that the incline was adjustable. I like to read while walking, and I can still do that on this little manual, but I have to hold on with one hand or I'll slide backwards.
customer_reviews.author: tiffers212

customer_reviews.title: Great treadmill!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an easy to use and compact treadmill and this is perfect. sure it is a little small and the belt can be tight at first, but after a day of breaking it in, it is perfect. if you are a gym snob who is use to $1000 treadmill's then this isn't for you. but it's $150! for the price it's excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for exercise, not sure of the meter
customer_reviews.text: The treadmill itself works well for exercising. This will come in very handy in the winter time. But the electronic meter/gauge the unit comes with does not seem very accurate. The craftsmanship is fine and seems to be a fairly sturdy treadmill.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Prime Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is actually a great treadmill! My husband had it put together in about 30 minutes. The incline is just enough to give you a workout as soon as you get going. It's slim, so it fits beside the bed without taking up much room. I'm very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Slaughter

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected!!!
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived 3 days after I ordered it! I only tried it once but I must say it was def worth the money. It's not fancy but it gets the job done. Used it 10 minutes and I was already sweating. One thing is you can't let go of the handles. Which isn't a big issue to me. It's the perfect size and I love the convenience! I'm happy with my order!
customer_reviews.author: briana

customer_reviews.title: At first I didn't like the incline
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for over 1 month, I've been using it almost every day for 1-3 miles walk. At first I didn't like the incline, but it gives me such a good work out, now I'm thanking the designer for it. I'm usually sweating before I hit one mile.
customer_reviews.author: C. Peng

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent manual treadmill. It does what you want it to do, its light, easy to maneuver, and a great way to drop a few pounds. I would defiantly recommend this if you are on a budget or just want something that is not going to take up a lot of space.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Grimlin

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: im a full time nursing student with 3 kids. living in an apartment building i didnt want anything that was going to be to big and loud. this thing is great doesnt take to much room. little advice to those that dont like this item... use it for more than a week and actually use it. you get what you pay for and i think its great. im 5'9 i dont have any problems with it. great product.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth pinon

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Functional
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this treadmill as a backup. It's not fancy but I get a good cardio workout on it. My other treadmill is a Treadclimber, which I, of course, like much better. However, this one was about one-tenth of the cost and fulfills its job requirements. It's sturdy and stable. Good display. I had no difficulty putting it together myself, with the exception of two screws that I had to have the manly-man tighten. :)
customer_reviews.author: Kristie Gray

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: my second one works great no trouble with it buy this more expensive one only for walking
customer_reviews.author: JLP

customer_reviews.title: Simple and light
customer_reviews.text: I love this treadmill, it is easy to move around and works great. I found it easy to put together. I like the option of having different places to put your hands. I find the angle to be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Mannhalter

product_meta.title: Phoenix 98510 Easy-Up Manual Treadmill
product_meta.description:
You power the belt, you achieve the most efficient walking/jogging result you wanted! Fold it up, lock it in place and roll it away for storage. It is just that easy - keep the unit out of your way when not in use. Warranty is 90 days parts, 1 year frame. Maximum user weight is 250lbs. Not recommended or guaranteed for user over this limit.

Note: Manual treadmill, it is self-powered and must hold onto the handles and walk with a fluid motion in order to make it work. Belt adjustment has been pre-adjusted; however, for information on belt adjustment page 13 from the manual can be viewed. 

AMAZON.COM
Most treadmills are frightfully expensive, with bulky electric motors that power the treadmill while jacking up the price. No so the Phoenix Easy-Up manual treadmill, which asks the user to power the belt instead. The treadmill is outfitted with a heavy-duty weighted flywheel and a sturdy running belt that respond to your walking/jogging speed. The faster you run, the faster the belt spins, letting you reach whatever speed is comfortable. At the same time, the treadmill isn't completely low tech, as it offers a single-button electronics display that tracks your speed, distance, time, and calories (includes two AA batteries). And users with small homes or apartments will love the spring-loaded pull pin, which lets you fold up the treadmill, lock it in place, and store it in a closet or garage. The Easy-Up treadmill--measures 46.5 by 50 by 21.1 inches (W x H x D). It also carries a 90-day warranty on parts and a one-year warranty on the frame. 

 Specifications:

 * Heavy duty weighted flywheel offers a smooth, quiet operation 
 * Spring loaded pull pin securely locks the unit in the upright (storage) position and makes it easy to release for operation 
 * Single button electronics displays speed, distance, time, calories and scan (two AA batteries included) 
 * Water bottle included 
 * Walking surface: 41" x 13" 
 * Dimensions: 46.5" x 21.1" x 50" (open); 21.7" x 21.1" x 50.2" (folded) 

 About Phoenix Health & Fitness
Established in 1998 as a wholesale distributor of fitness equipment, Phoenix Health & Fitness offers a complete line of high-quality exercise equipment to the in-home and light commercial markets. Working with a state-of-the-art computer system, the company can offer "just in time" delivery and other critical services while living up to its standards of reliability, consistency, honesty, and urgency. Phoenix Health & Fitness develops many of its new concepts and products in conjunction with its sister company, Reflex Design, and enjoys a reputation for delivering quality products in a timely manner.

 About Treadmills
Walking is still considered one of the most beneficial cardiovascular exercises for people of all ages, body types, and fitness levels. As a fundamental form of aerobic training, walking has numerous physical benefits for the heart, lungs, and circulatory system, while also increasing muscle tone and burning fat calories. Treadmills provide a convenient way to regularly exercise in all weather conditions in the comfort and safety of your own home.

 From beginners just starting an exercise regimen to advanced athletes looking to maintain their fitness level, anyone interested in getting and staying in shape can benefit greatly from regular use of a treadmill. Treadmills allow you to determine the pace, distance, and complexity of the workout based on your needs, all while watching television, talking on the telephone, or reading a magazine. Much easier on sensitive joints like the knees and hips, treadmill walking and running surfaces are typically long, padded platforms that allow ample room for a long stride and comfortable, low-impact walk or jog without the harsh contact of a concrete surface.

 While many different types, styles, and price ranges of treadmills exist, many of them offer unique features like a fold-up design for easy storage, an electronic display monitor showing speed, distance, workout time, incline level, and burned calories, and EKG grip pulses to monitor the heart rate while exercising. Regardless of the simple to complex features you may choose, treadmills offer an array of aerobic exercise opportunities that will provide long-lasting beneficial cardiovascular results without a commute to the gym or a jog in the rain.
feature_bullets: Phoenix 98510 Easy-Up Manual treadmill with heavy-duty weighted flywheel and 41-by-13-inch belt
Single-button electronics display tracks speed, distance, time, and calories
Lets you achieve maximum walking/jogging speed via self-powered workout
Folds and locks in upright position for storage; includes water bottle
Measures 46.5 x 50 x 21.1 inches (W x H x D); 1-year frame warranty
